017package org.apache.juneau.uon;
018
019import java.io.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
022
023/**
024 * Same functionality as {@link ParserReader} except automatically decoded <c>%xx</c> escape sequences.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Escape sequences are assumed to be encoded UTF-8.  Extended Unicode (&gt;\u10000) is supported.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * If decoding is enabled, the following character replacements occur so that boundaries are not lost:
031 * <ul>
032 *    <li><js>'&amp;'</js> -&gt; <js>'\u0001'</js>
033 *    <li><js>'='</js> -&gt; <js>'\u0002'</js>
034 * </ul>
035 *
036 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
037 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/UonBasics">UON Basics</a>
038
039 * </ul>
040 */
041public class UonReader extends ParserReader {
042
043   private final boolean decodeChars;
044   private final char[] buff;
045
046   // Writable properties.
047   private int iCurrent, iEnd;
048
049   /**
050    * Constructor.
051    *
052    * @param pipe The parser input.
053    * @param decodeChars Whether the input is URL-encoded.
054    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
055    */
056   public UonReader(ParserPipe pipe, boolean decodeChars) throws IOException {
057      super(pipe);
058      this.decodeChars = decodeChars;
059      if (pipe.isString()) {
060         String in = pipe.getInputAsString();
061         this.buff = new char[in.length() < 1024 ? in.length() : 1024];
062      } else {
063         this.buff = new char[1024];
064      }
065   }
066
067   @Override /* Reader */
068   public int read(char[] cbuf, int off, int len) throws IOException {
069
070      if (! decodeChars)
071         return super.read(cbuf, off, len);
072
073      // Copy any remainder to the beginning of the buffer.
074      int remainder = iEnd - iCurrent;
075      if (remainder > 0)
076         System.arraycopy(buff, iCurrent, buff, 0, remainder);
077      iCurrent = 0;
078
079      int expected = buff.length - remainder;
080
081      int x = super.read(buff, remainder, expected);
082      if (x == -1 && remainder == 0)
083         return -1;
084
085      iEnd = remainder + (x == -1 ? 0 : x);
086
087      int i = 0;
088      while (i < len) {
089         if (iCurrent >= iEnd)
090            return i;
091         char c = buff[iCurrent++];
092         if (c == '+') {
093            cbuf[off + i++] = ' ';
094         } else if (c == '&') {
095            cbuf[off + i++] = '\u0001';
096         } else if (c == '=') {
097            cbuf[off + i++] = '\u0002';
098         } else if (c != '%') {
099            cbuf[off + i++] = c;
100         } else {
101            int iMark = iCurrent-1;  // Keep track of current position.
102
103            // Stop if there aren't at least two more characters following '%' in the buffer,
104            // or there aren't at least two more positions open in cbuf to handle double-char chars.
105            if (iMark+2 >= iEnd || i+2 > len) {
106               iCurrent--;
107               return i;
108            }
109
110            int b0 = readEncodedByte();
111            int cx;
112
113            // 0xxxxxxx
114            if (b0 < 128) {
115               cx = b0;
116
117            // 10xxxxxx
118            } else if (b0 < 192) {
119               throw new IOException("Invalid hex value for first escape pattern in UTF-8 sequence:  "+b0);
120
121            // 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
122            // 11000000(192) - 11011111(223)
123            } else if (b0 < 224) {
124               cx = readUTF8(b0-192, 1);
125               if (cx == -1) {
126                  iCurrent = iMark;
127                  return i;
128               }
129
130            // 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
131            // 11100000(224) - 11101111(239)
132            } else if (b0 < 240) {
133               cx = readUTF8(b0-224, 2);
134               if (cx == -1) {
135                  iCurrent = iMark;
136                  return i;
137               }
138
139            // 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
140            // 11110000(240) - 11110111(247)
141            } else if (b0 < 248) {
142               cx = readUTF8(b0-240, 3);
143               if (cx == -1) {
144                  iCurrent = iMark;
145                  return i;
146               }
147
148            } else
149               throw new IOException("Invalid hex value for first escape pattern in UTF-8 sequence:  "+b0);
150
151            if (cx < 0x10000)
152               cbuf[off + i++] = (char)cx;
153            else {
154               cx -= 0x10000;
155               cbuf[off + i++] = (char)(0xd800 + (cx >> 10));
156               cbuf[off + i++] = (char)(0xdc00 + (cx & 0x3ff));
157            }
158         }
159      }
160      return i;
161   }
162
163   private int readUTF8(int n, final int numBytes) throws IOException {
164      if (iCurrent + numBytes*3 > iEnd)
165         return -1;
166      for (int i = 0; i < numBytes; i++) {
167         n <<= 6;
168         n += readHex()-128;
169      }
170      return n;
171   }
172
173   private int readHex() throws IOException {
174      int c = buff[iCurrent++];
175      if (c != '%')
176         throw new IOException("Did not find expected '%' character in UTF-8 sequence.");
177      return readEncodedByte();
178   }
179
180   private int readEncodedByte() throws IOException {
181      if (iEnd <= iCurrent + 1)
182         throw new IOException("Incomplete trailing escape pattern");
183      int h = buff[iCurrent++];
184      int l = buff[iCurrent++];
185      h = fromHexChar(h);
186      l = fromHexChar(l);
187      return (h << 4) + l;
188   }
189
190   private static int fromHexChar(int c) throws IOException {
191      if (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
192         return c - '0';
193      if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f')
194         return 10 + c - 'a';
195      if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'F')
196         return 10 + c - 'A';
197      throw new IOException("Invalid hex character '"+c+"' found in escape pattern.");
198   }
199
200   @Override /* ParserReader */
201   public UonReader unread() throws IOException {
202      super.unread();
203      return this;
204   }
205}
